metadata.title: CVE-2019-16942 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A Polymorphic Typing issue was discovered in FasterXML jackson-databind2.0.0 through 2.9.10. When Default Typing is enabled (either globally orfor a specific property) for an externally exposed JSON endpoint and theservice has the commons-dbcp (1.4) jar in the classpath, and an attackercan find an RMI service endpoint to access, it is possible to make theservice execute a malicious payload. This issue exists because oforg.apache.commons.dbcp.datasources.SharedPoolDataSource andorg.apache.commons.dbcp.datasources.PerUserPoolDataSource mishandling.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16942` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjackson2-databind-java - 2.10.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jackson-databind package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.10.0-2').
